page.title: 04FARMING IN HIGHER POYNTON(1)
page.content: Most of the land in our area is used for farming, not housing. This is mainly animal farming as the land is quite hilly(251m at its highest point not really suitable for planting crops.We visited 6 farms in all making appointments by telephone with the farmers. All 6 farms are owned by their occupants, but 2 of them are only smallholdings with a few animals such as ducks and donkeys.None of the farms grew crops, though many had large gardens where they grew enough vegetables for their family needs.Cows chickens,sheep and pigs are all kept on the farms. Hagg Farm had 3 acres of land and was the smallest, being really a smallholding. Hill Top Farm was by far the largest with 95 acres.
